Wear a hat: A wide-brimmed hat can provide excellent protection for the head and face from the sun's harmful rays. It also helps to keep the head cool and comfortable during hot weather.
Use sunscreen: Apply a broad-spectrum sunscreen with an SPF of at least 30 to the scalp regularly. This will help prevent sunburn and protect against harmful UV radiation.
Wear a scarf: A lightweight, breathable scarf can provide an extra layer of protection for the head and neck from the sun's rays. It can also help to keep the head warm during cooler weather.
Use a beach umbrella: A beach umbrella can provide excellent shade for the head and neck, protecting it from the sun's rays. It can also be used as a makeshift tent for outdoor activities.

Wear a wig or hairpiece: A wig or hairpiece made of natural or synthetic fibers can provide an alternative to natural hair, while also providing protection from the sun's rays. It can also help to maintain a sense of style and confidence.
